metadata.title: USN-2557-1 -- Firefox vulnerability
metadata.description: Muneaki Nishimura discovered a flaw in Mozilla's HTTP Alternative Services implementation which meant SSL certificate verification could be bypassed in some circumstances. A remote attacker could potentially exploit this to conduct a machine-in-the-middle attack. (CVE-2015-0799)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-2557-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  firefox-locale-nl - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1 firefox-locale-nn - 37.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1 firefox-locale-nb -
